name: Original Sokos Hotel Viru

reviews.text: I had a standard room and it was planty big enough, double bed, sofa and desk. The price was very good. I was offered an upgrade to a bigger room on arrival but reallly glad i didn't take it as there was no need. The hotel has a small pub, a bar and a nightclub. It also has a very nice Tex-Mex restraunt. If i was returning to Tallin i would be stopping here again!
reviews.title: Great hotel, right next to the old town of Tallin

reviews.text: Stayed on the 21st floor of this hotel for nearly two weeks. The hotel itself is in a excellent location, as it is situated very close to public transport and and the centre of Tallinn itself; the historical old centre of Tallinn being a 2 minute walk away and a shopping centre attached to the hotel and another a 5 minute walk away. There is also a super-market in the basement of the shopping centre attached.
reviews.title: Very good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very well furnished room (Double room), with it's own air conditioning unit that has a variety of settings. Cupboard with 6 hangers, an ironing board and iron, including information for dry cleaning and regular cleaning. Complimentary small sewing kit and shoe-cleaners. Large flat-screen TV encased in wood. Small mini-bar fridge with a variety of alcoholic drinks and some snacks. To the left is a space where you can put your luggage and store it underneath, and the same is to the right. By the large glass window are two swivel chairs and a round table, including two cushions either side of the window sill with power points nearby where one can sit and work looking out at the view across Tallinn. Overall well furnished and a good amount of space with a pleasing colour coordination.
reviews.title: Not worth its stars

reviews.text: The beds are comfortable and clean. Both have next to them light switches that enable you to turn off the main lighting whilst in bed, or choose to have 'mood lighting' on instead. The rooms get cleaned everyday, and towels e.t.c replaced. There is a door-hanger which you can hang up outside the door if you do not wish to be disturbed.
reviews.title: Great location hotel in Estonia

reviews.text: Location is just perfect - right near the magnificent Old Town. Hotel is always crowded, but they have enough staff to deal with any of your inquiries. They have very nice bars and a couple of restaurants. Hotel is really huge, so you can almost get lost in some parts of the building. But rooms are clean, spacious and comfortable enough. Price is also very fair. Tallinn is quite a small town, so getting here from the airport by taxi won't take more when 10 minutes, ferry terminal is also quite close.
reviews.title: Good place to stay in Tallinn

reviews.text: I stayed here a couple of nights for work and really thought it was a perfect hotel. The location was amazing for going into the old town and the hotel bar was also perfect for winding down after a long day. The room was fairly basic but was clean and comfortable, and did the job. Would definitely consider this hotel again.
reviews.title: Amazing location and great hotel bar

reviews.text: stayed there a few times last year, staff very plesent and helpful, very close to old town, breakfast is very good, No 2 bus from airport stops a minutes walk from hotel (through shopping centre) only 1euro, also No 90 bus, its 2euro, had booked room with smoking request but was told hotel now has no smoking policy, (dont know if all hotels are now the same), gave us a room on 20th floor, great views of town and harbour, but you have to go out onto the balcony between rooms for a smoke,one at each end of the corridor, not great on a freezing cold morning or night, there is a smoking room on the 2nd floor no seats in it and you feel like your in a goldfish bowl, all glass, room on 20th floor very small, had to bend under the TV on the wall to get to one side of the bed, older rooms were bigger,,but overall a good value hotel.
reviews.title: hotel now has no smoking policy

reviews.text: The hotel is very modern. The location is very good. In his spare time, you can walk to visit close by attractions. The most important include: Cathedral of Saint. reviews.text: Arriving late one afternoon, I called in to the 5 star Swiss Hotel. Their prices were beyond what I could afford at the time but they recommended (and even booked!) this hotel for me despite having no connection with it. Whilst I have been in plusher 4 star hotels (I would rate this one as 3 and a half stars), it is only 5 minutes walk to the old town, close to the port, has a shopping mall underneath and internet facilities in the foyer. Breakfast for such an establishment is okay but busy, as with many hotels at peak times. Flooring in the rooms (I have used two) was polished wood rather than carpet - I am old fashioned and prefer warmer carpet and I would have liked to see coffee making facilities in the room. However, for the reasonable price they charge in the centre of a capital city, I certainly cannot complain. The excellent tram network passes the corner of the hotel making travel to outerlying parts of the city easy; because of this, however, I would recommend a higher floor should the traffic noise be a problem for you.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: I stayed at Viru with a friend and we were all and all happy with the place. Location is excellent and the service was very friendly and flexible. Our room was clean and spacious and the beds comfortable . The breakfast was good, no surprises to either direction there. The hotel has a free Wi-Fi-connection.
reviews.title: Friendly and flexible

description: If you haven’t been in the legendary Viru Hotel, you haven’t seen all of Tallinn. The first skyscraper and prominent landmark in Estonia offers breathtaking views of Tallinn Bay and Tallinn’s UNESCO protected medieval Old Town. The hotel has the widest range of room types, restaurants, entertainment facilities, relaxation services and the “must see” KGB museum all under the same roof. Original Sokos Hotel Viru provides direct access to the Viru Centre shopping mall and is close to theatres and popular cultural centres.
